ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Refers to muscle, fat, fibrous tissue, blood vessels, or other supporting tissue of the body.:A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact. -- 2003

Concepts.definition: A general term comprising tissue that is not hardened or calcified; including muscle, fat, blood vessels, nerves, tendons, ligaments and fascia.
A disorder resulting from the presence and activity of a microbial, viral, fungal, or parasitic agent. It can be transmitted by direct or indirect contact.

Concepts.definition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.
Knowledge on which to base belief.
